info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 12 at 10:22PM EDT until May 17 at 4:15AM EDT by NWS Columbia SC
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina...
Congaree River At Congaree River at Congaree NP Near Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties.
Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Calhoun, Lexington and Richland Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Congaree River at Carolina Eastman.
* WHEN...Until early Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding occurs in low lying areas of the Carolina Eastman Facility and at the Congaree National Park. At 119.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs in the Congaree National Park. Some area farmland is flooded. Minor flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:04 PM EDT Monday the stage was 116.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 114.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:04 PM EDT Monday was 116.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 119.8 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 115.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Flooded roadways are nearly impossible to see at night. Avoid traveling in this area. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1030 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Calhoun, SC; Lexington, SC; Richland, SC
